flawed_nl_solution:
If Emerie has six quarters, Zain has 6+10 = <<6+10=16>>16 quarters.
At the same time, Zain has 7+10 = <<7+10=17>>17 dimes, ten more than Emerie.
The total number of quarters and dimes Zain has is 17+16 = <<17+16=33>>33 coins.
Zain also has 10 more nickels than Emerie, a total of 10+5 = <<10+5=51>>51 nickels.
In total, Zain has 33+51 = <<33+51=84>>84 coins.
#### 84

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 15, not 51. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
